channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024070418
item.description:
Report X-2024070418

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024070418 attachment Name:download (10).png 2. X-2024070419 A tugger brought over the package and placed it on the hazmat pallet in QA. At first glance, I could see the "HAZ" on the shipping label, but the packaging is a corrugated box with no dot or OP-900. Upon inspecting the package, I noticed a few wet spots on the inside of the box. All bottles had vented caps and leaked during transit. No orientation arrows on the box to ensure the safety of the contents and there were no packing materials as well.

item.title: Report X-2024070478
item.description:
Report X-2024070478

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: ALLENTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TILX 320135 was found leaking under movement by yard crew. Car was isolated and a NS approved contractor was dispatched. Contractor determined manway swing bolts were tight, but gasket was ripped and torn on parts of it. Manway lid gasket was replaced with a nozzle gasket and secured properly for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024070113
item.description:
Report E-2024070113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a drum that was slightly leaking from the bottom. Further investigation revealed that a binder clip that was holding the paperwork for the drum had wedged itself between the drum and the pallet the drum was staged on and during the course of transportation the drum shifted and hut the binder clip which consequently slightly punctured the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured drum.

item.title: Report I-2024070019
item.description:
Report I-2024070019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: Philadelphia
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At PHL, on 6/04/2024, Delta Dangerous Goods management was notified of an undeclared shipment of 6 loose butane Iighters in a cargo shipment at PHL Cargo facility. The Iighters were identified by the cargo agent screening the package. The package was then rejected for air transport. The air waybill declared personal effects, clothing and electronics.

item.title: Report X-2024070235
item.description:
Report X-2024070235

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection 2 X 1 gallon plastic bottles of Zep concentrated industrial purple degreaser. 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of degreaser had a loose cap allowing 1 gallon to release, soiling the other 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of degreaser. No slotted partition or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024070211
item.description:
Report X-2024070211

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A POSSIBLE HAZMAT LEAKER AT PACKAGE CAR. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER FOUND A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH WET CORNERS. USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS RESPONDER CAREFULLY LOADED THE PACKAGE ONTO A SPILL TRAY LINED WITH GREEN BAG AND PROCEEDED TO CLEAN UP THE SURROUNDING AREA. THEN BROUGHT THE PACK BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS RESPONDER CAREFULLY TRANSFERED THE HAZMAT ONTO A SPILL TRAY LINED WITH GREEN BAG AND CLEANED UP THE SURROUNDING AREA. THEN BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024070179

  • Description: WEARING FULL PPE RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DA/OVERGOODS AREA FOR A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. FOUND A HAZMAT BOX WITH A LITTLE WET SPOT ON THE TOP CORNER. USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CAREFULLY EXAMINED THE PACKAGE AND LOADED IT ONTO A SPILLED TRAY LINED WITH GREEN BAG AND PROCEED TO CLEAN THE AREA AND THEN BROUGHT THE HAZMAT PACKAGE BACK FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024070123
item.description:
Report X-2024070123

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 12 HOUR RESPONDER SUMMONED TO RECYCLE CHUTE FOR AN OPEN BOX WITH LEAKING CONTENTS. RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE, CONSULTED DECISION TREE RESPONSE SHEETS, TRANSPORTED THE PKG BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. THE SIDE OF THE BOX WAS TORN, AND THE PAIL INSIDE WAS PROTRUDING FROM THE BOX. THE PAIL LID WAS SLIGHTLY AJAR, AND POWDER WAS LEAKING OUT. THE PAIL HAD A 5.1 OXIDIZER DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL, "UN 2468" "TRICLOROISOCYANURIC ACID, DRY" PRINTED ON THE PAIL. THERE WERE NO INDICATIONS OF A DANGEROUS GOOD ON THE OUTSIDE CARTON OR THERMAL LABEL. THE BOX HAD NO MANUFACTURER MARKS, UN SPEC MARKS, OR ANY INDICATION OF THE BOX STRENGTH. SHIPMENT CALLED INTO HMSC AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. PKG AWAITING CLEARANCE FOR DMP DAMAGE PROCESSING IN ETT.
